intro: Afrolicania, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a striking tropical plant native to parts of Africa. It is characterized by its large, showy orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters during the dry season. The plant has a distinctive, umbrella-shaped canopy with compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its rapid growth and ornamental value make it popular in landscaping, though it can become invasive in some regions. Afrolicania thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it adaptable to various tropical and subtropical climates.
